intro: Hieracium schisticolor, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a surrounding ray floret. Hieracium schisticolor is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
